Description: Pottery jar decorated with two circles in black, made from Egyptian clay in Middle Minoan II style.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Nile silt fabric. Fitton, J.L., Hughes, M. and Quirke, S. (1998), ‘Northerners at Lahun: Neutron Activation Analysis of Minoan and related pottery in the British Museum’, in S. Quirke (ed.) Lahun Studies, p. 124
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (A563)
Kemp & Merrillees 1980 / Minoan Pottery in Second Millennium Egypt (Ka.21) (p. 70)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2014 – 2015, 9 October – 26 January, Palais des Beaux Arts de Lille, Senusret III. The Conquering Pharoah
